bibl.title: Further Notes on Interrelated Greek and Coptic Documents of the Sixth and Seventh Centuries.
bibl.note: The fifth century saw the growth of regular and secular clergy in Egypt. It may have been their role as mediators in people's daily affairs with the government that aided the rise of Coptic as a documentary vehicle.
bibl.seg: MacCOULL Leslie S.B., Further Notes on Interrelated Greek and Coptic Documents of the Sixth and Seventh Centuries.

The fifth century saw the growth of regular and secular clergy in Egypt. It may have been their role as mediators in people's daily affairs with the government that aided the rise of Coptic as a documentary vehicle.
